title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Child Rumination Syndrome
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Child Rumination Syndrome provides criteria for diagnosis of child rumination syndrome.

orgreference.text: Hyams J, Di lorenzo C, Forbes D, et al. Childhood functional gastrointestinal disorders: child/adolescent. Gastroenterology. 2006;130(5):1527-37.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for child rumination syndrome, patient must have the following (for ≥2 months prior):

  1. Repeated regurgitation and rechewing or expulsion of food that:
    1. Begins soon after ingestion of a meal.
    2. Does not occur during sleep.
  2. Not preceded by retching.
  3. After appropriate evaluation, the symptoms cannot be fully explained by another medical condition (an eating disorder must be ruled out).
